text: if you were to give everybody an idea of
like
foundationally fundamentally what makes
envoy different than
an nginx used as a proxy right or as h.a
proxy
what is that yeah i think the biggest
technical difference
is that and there's lots of
non-technical differences that are very
interesting to
talk about but i think the biggest
technical difference is that envoy
was created to deal with modern
elastic you know people call it cloud
native architectures right
so you know things are auto scaling you
have container run times things are
coming and going things are always
failing
so envoy was built to have an eventually
consistent configuration system
and now we have a suite of apis which we
call xds
and those are a set of apis that allows
envoy to dynamically fetch things like
route configuration or listener
configuration or cluster configuration
so you know in a simple config enboy can
be statically configured just like hd
proxy and nginx
but really from the beginning envoy was
built to you know be able to change all
of its config on the fly
without without having to reload and
that's a really big difference
from the way that historically you know
aj proxy and
nginx have typically done their own
config
now since envoy has come out both nginx
and hd proxy have had to evolve in this
area
also to work with these more modern
architectures but i think that's the
biggest technical difference
